title: Clutch Cable - Removal

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
Loosen the cable lock nut and release the adjuster at the clutch cover end to give maximum play in the cable.

body.name: Clutch Cable - adjust gbox end L0705

body.body: Detach the inner clutch cable from the boss on the clutch actuating arm.

body.name: Clutch Cable - Removal gearbox end cixi D Series.svg)

body.body: Detach the cable retaining guides from the frame down tube.
Align the cable adjuster and lever bracket slots.
Pull in the clutch lever and turn the inner cable adjuster anticlockwise through the lock nut, until the cable can be detached from the lever.

body.name: Detach clutch cable lever end L0338

body.body: To make sure the same route can be followed on installation, tie a length of string to one end while pulling the cable through from the other. When installing the new cable, tie the string to one end of the cable and use it to guide the new cable into position.
Noting the cable routing and retaining guides, remove the cable from the motorcycle.

Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.

Detach the inner clutch cable from the boss on the clutch actuating arm.

Detach the cable retaining guides from the frame down tube.
Align the cable adjuster and lever bracket slots.

Cable release point

To make sure the same route can be followed on installation, tie a length of string to one end while pulling the cable through from the other. When installing the new cable, tie the string to one end of the cable and use it to guide the new cable into position.
Noting the cable routing and retaining guides, remove the cable from the motorcycle.
